Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ClientSession

  • public interface ClientSession
    Operations available in an established SMTP session.

    This interface is provided to the handler after a successful EHLO or HELO command, and represents the "ready" state where the client can:

    • Begin a mail transaction with mailFrom()
    • Upgrade to TLS with starttls() (if offered by server)
    • Authenticate with auth() (if offered by server)
    • Close the connection with quit()

    After successful message delivery, the handler receives this interface again, allowing multiple messages to be sent over a single connection.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ServerEhloReplyHandler.handleEhlo(boolean, long, java.util.List<java.lang.String>, boolean, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientSession), ServerHeloReplyHandler.handleHelo(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientSession)

    • Method Detail

      • mailFrom

        void mailFrom​(EmailAddress sender,
              ServerMailFromReplyHandler callback)
        Begins a mail transaction with the specified sender.
        Parameters:
        sender - the envelope sender address
        callback - receives the server's response

      • mailFrom

        void mailFrom​(EmailAddress sender,
              long size,
              ServerMailFromReplyHandler callback)
        Begins a mail transaction with sender and message size hint.

        The size parameter is only useful if the server advertised the SIZE extension in its EHLO response. It allows the server to reject messages that would exceed limits before content is transferred.

        Parameters:
        sender - the envelope sender address
        size - the estimated message size in bytes
        callback - receives the server's response

      • starttls

        void starttls​(ServerStarttlsReplyHandler callback)
        Upgrades the connection to TLS.

        This should only be called if the server advertised STARTTLS in its EHLO response. After successful TLS upgrade, the handler must re-issue EHLO as required by RFC 3207.

        Parameters:
        callback - receives the server's response

      • auth

        void auth​(java.lang.String mechanism,
          byte[] initialResponse,
          ServerAuthReplyHandler callback)
        Initiates SASL authentication.

        This should only be called if the server advertised AUTH in its EHLO response. The mechanism should be one of those offered by the server.

        Parameters:
        mechanism - the SASL mechanism name (e.g., "PLAIN", "LOGIN", "XOAUTH2")
        initialResponse - initial response bytes for mechanisms that support it (may be null for mechanisms like LOGIN)
        callback - receives the server's response

      • quit

        void quit()
        Closes the connection gracefully.

        Sends a QUIT command and closes the connection. The connection handles the server's 221 response internally.
